body:
`@astrojs/language-server@2.0.0` utilizes Volar language server under the hood. The LSP's init_options are located [here][1]. `typescript.serverPath` has been renamed to `typescript.tsdk`. There is no `configuration`; that option is for the VSCode extension, located in the `astro-vscode` package [here][2].

[1]: https://github.com/volarjs/volar.js/blob/dfc8ccefb6c3aa53bd0eb9755259538a11127edd/packages/language-server/src/types.ts#L50
[2]: https://github.com/withastro/language-tools/blob/eb2ce0b3effd00e49294be57ef0f3d1cb5f8f454/packages/vscode/package.json#L126

comment_data.body: if this field don't need set any value in there. can be don't set this field. just remove this line.
Yup, almost forgot that it's what I do in my config.
these lines should keep just remove tsdk

```suggestion
        if vim.tbl_get(new_config.init_options, 'typescript') and not new_config.init_options.typescript.tsdk then
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -11,19 +11,13 @@ return {
     cmd = { 'astro-ls', '--stdio' },
     filetypes = { 'astro' },
     root_dir = util.root_pattern('package.json', 'tsconfig.json', 'jsconfig.json', '.git'),
-    init_options = {
-      typescript = {
-        serverPath = '',
-      },
-      configuration = {},
-    },
     on_new_config = function(new_config, new_root_dir)
       if
         new_config.init_options

comment_data.body: Just `init_options` or should we also keep `init_options.typescript`?

comment_data.body: Please see if it's correct now.

comment_regular_data.body: I don't know about `commit_lint` man... It seems unorthodox to me. Maybe I can tolerate linting the Conventional Commits rules, but limiting the footer to 100 characters when that's actually supposed a place to link things? Just a thought.
don't worry I can do some change for it .

title: fix(astro): update astro config for @astrojs/language-server v2.0.0
